p.s: The given scene of the movie The Hate U Give by George Tillmann Jr. from 2018, which is about a teenage girl of colour speaking up about racism, is about the conflict between Maverick and King after Starr's TVtelevision interview.
In this scene the family is having dinner in a restaurant.
They are praying, telling how thankful they're for their families, and starting to eat, when TVtelevision realizes King's standing outside, in front of their car.
As soon as Maverick realizes him, he goes outside and tells him to leave his family.
Maverick punches King and the police comes.
King runs away and the police officers get Maverick.
They want his IDidentification and push him to the ground.

Maverick tells his family to go into the restaurant again but instead they start to speak up for him and Starr (and some other people) start filming the black police officer pushing Maverick to the ground.
When the white police officer realizes, Starr is the whitnesswitness, he tells the other to leave and they drive away.
They all check on eachothereach other and the mother goes to care for Sekani, who's crying.
